item.title: Drag x Drive Hits Launches On Nintendo Switch 2 This August
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has revealed that its upcoming 3v3 basketball game, Drag x Drive, will launch on August 14. Announced during the Switch 2 reveal presentation, the game sees players use Joy-Con 2 mouse controls to move players in wheelchairs around the court and score goals. 

Nintendo revealed the release date in its Nintendo Today app, where it also announced a new Splatoon game earlier this month. Despite knowing when Drag x Drive launches on Switch 2, we still don't know how much the game will cost. Neither the Nintendo Today app nor the game's listing on the Nintendo eShop features the price, so we'll have to wait and see. 

Check out the Drag x Drive reveal trailer below: 

In the meantime, read Game Informer's Switch 2 review and our Mario Kart World review. After that, check out our list of the Switch 2 games to play after you're done with Mario Kart World, and then read Game Informer's hands-on Drag x Drive preview thoughts. 

Are you going to pick up Drag x Drive in August? Let us know in the comments below!
